snippet: The judges of the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit peppered a prosecutor with questions about an informer’s role in a plot to blow up synagogues in the Bronx.
abstract: Panel of three federal appellate judges in Manhattan sharply questions government’s tactics and the use of informants in undercover terrorism investigations; questioning comes during oral arguments in the appeals of four men from Newburgh, NY, who were convicted in 2010 in a plot to blow up synagogues in the Bronx and shoot down military planes at Stewart International Airport.
lead_paragraph: The judges of the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit peppered a prosecutor with questions about an informer’s role in a plot to blow up synagogues in the Bronx.

headline.seo: Government Tactics in Bronx Synagogue Bombing Case Are Questioned in Appeal
headline.main: Judges Question Tactics in Bronx Bomb Case
